file_content.text: Our weapons will make the Imperials and White Maw sorry they were ever born.
We're slowly gaining ground in Clabburn Sector. We'll win this planet yet.
Welcome back. Word's all over the comm channels of your victory against a Sith and... some beast army? Just when I think I've heard it all.
I'm glad I had a Jedi war hero around to handle things.
I was just doing what had to be done, General. The Force was with us today.
I'm no hero.
Today and until this war's over, I hope.
For a diplomat, you're certainly good at eliminating a threat.
Jedi must be ready to fight when words aren't enough.
I'm more than a negotiator.
Words won't solve anything on Hoth. Nobody's listening.
Havoc Squad earns its reputation again.
If we didn't keep achieving the impossible, my people would get bored.
Happy to serve, sir.
The best of the best, indeed.
I took down my share of bad guys--not that it was a competition....
It was a team effort.
I don't pay by the enemy, if that's what you're getting at.
Apparently, Senator Dodonna has good taste in privateers.
Don't give her too much credit. She's only a politician.
Maybe she just got lucky.
Ha! I won't tell her you said that.
We were fortunate to have such a brave warrior on our side.
My friend led us to victory.
High praise, coming from you.
My friend has a talent for surviving impossible odds.
Truly, an impressive ally.
Clearly, so do you.
Wish I'd gotten holos of my friend in action. It was quite a show.
You should've seen the fight.
Impressing the leader of Havoc Squad is a feat in itself.
That was quite a ride.
The men are telling some pretty outrageous stories. I hope they're true.
Nothing to it.
Naturally humble, hmm? Humility's overrated, in my book.
Now that our men are safe, it's time to end this quagmire. We've wasted too many good soldiers fighting a conventional war on Hoth.
The Republic has reserves of pathogenic and toxic weapons. There's no reason not to use them here, besides the Senate's squeamishness.
Maybe the Senate has reason to fear using them. How do they work?
Describe these weapons.
The toxins and pathogens are in gaseous form. They're launched via missile and disperse on impact. Anybody caught inside the gas cloud regrets it.
Those sound like weapons the Empire would use, not us.
Aren't those things illegal?
I think it's high time the Empire got a taste of its own tactics. As for White Maw, those pirates get what they deserve.
The only reason they have the luxury of moralizing is because we protect them.
Ignore the Senators.
Fighting honorably is what almost got us destroyed in the last war.
Once Clabburn Sector is fully secured, we'll move in artillery platforms. Hit the enemy with every nasty poison and disease we've got.
The best part is, our enemies won't die right away. They'll run back to their bases and share the pain with friends.
General, what you're planning won't discriminate between friend and foe. Those weapons could kill innocent people, including ours.
We shouldn't use such weapons.
You sound like those blasted Senators.... The only difference is, I respect your opinion.
If you think we can win Hoth the hard way, I'm willing to try. Maybe conventional missile payloads will be enough.
Sounds like you've found a winning strategy, General.
Good. Kill them all.
We'll show those White Maw scum and Imperials that the Republic knows how to fight a war.
It'll take some time to get the missile platforms down to the surface and set up. But the fight? That'll be short.
Your service was exemplary. The men won't forget what you did. Neither will I.
If we don't deal with whatever's murdering my men out there, Hoth is a lost cause.
Bureaucratic fools. Never seen the business end of a blaster, but they'll tell me how to run a war....
Consider yourself lucky, Master Jedi. You can fight your battles without answering to politicians.
We all have our masters. The Jedi Council's standards are high.
No, but I answer to someone.
There's never been a Jedi who hasn't faced death. You people understand the cost of fighting a war.
No offense, Master Jedi. As diplomats go, you're alright. Not like those politicians full of "useful advice."
In my experience, most politicians are decent enough--if you take the time to understand them.
They aren't so bad.
I've dealt with elected leaders for most of my career. I'll never fathom what goes through their so-called minds.
You know what I mean, don't you, Captain? Havoc Squad's had more than its share of political interference.
If the government didn't sign my pay vouchers, I wouldn't have any use for it.
You can say that again.
Ha! Have to remember that one....
You should look into the private sector. The pay's great, you set your own hours and you still get to shoot people.
I answer to nobody.
Senator Dodonna's privateer. She speaks highly of you, Captain--for whatever that's worth.
At least Senator Dodonna has a clue what it takes to win--even if it means hiring mercenaries like you. No offense.
I pride myself on being a good value for the credits.
None taken.
Your kill count's impressive, I'll give you that.
We're winning the war for Hoth. The Empire and those White Maw pirates won't last much longer, sir.
Don't give in to frustration.
I know you've done your part, but the Senate keeps tying our hands.
Everyone contributes to the war effort in their own way--even politicians.
We're all doing our part.
The Senate contributes plenty of bad ideas, that's for certain. You, on the other hand, are an actual war hero.
Never mind the politicians, sir. If there's a war to win, we're the ones who will do it.
It's under control, General.
Havoc Squad's a blasted fine outfit, Captain. But you can't replace the troops we've lost from the Senate's bad decisions.
Back up. Tell me everything.
Sorry. Long flight getting here. Obviously, I know who you are--and I'm glad you're here.
I've seen most of what this planet has to offer. Still can't figure out why anyone is fighting over it.
The war on Hoth is pointless.
The war's not pointless--how we're fighting it is. That has to change.
I'm Hoth's new chief strategist. My predecessor dug us into a deep hole fighting this war by the Senate's rules.
He controlled Clabburn Sector--a prime piece of real estate--for months and never capitalized on it. Now we're in danger of losing our best shot at victory.
What makes this patch of ice and snow different from the others?
Is it really that important?
It's perfectly positioned for accurate long-range artillery attacks on enemy bases. Whoever controls that sector takes this world.
Victory belongs to the brave.
Our men are fighting with all they've got--but they need help.
Let me know how it turns out.
Hang on. You don't understand what's at stake.
We could win Hoth using Clabburn Sector's artillery position, but my predecessor let the enemy crowd us out. We need to secure that region.
And now we've got another problem. Whole squads being ripped apart by... something. Don't know what. All we find are butchered remains.
There are lots of hungry beasts out there.
Hoth has many predators.
I'm not talking about some rogue wampa or whitefang pack.
Butchered with what?
So little is left of our men, we can't tell what happened to them. They aren't being killed by conventional weapons.
That's war. People die.
These aren't random attacks--but it's not the Imperials or White Maw, either. Whatever's doing this is vicious. Slaughtering us for pleasure.
This enemy takes our men by surprise, tears them to pieces and vanishes without a trace. The soldiers are terrified, but we can't retreat.
You need someone who specializes in dealing with extreme threats.
This is no ordinary enemy.
Even our best men aren't equipped to fight what they can't find.
Not even to save your men?
Under any other circumstance I'd order a tactical withdrawal. But if we fall back, we may as well give up.
How is this my problem?
You've been fighting for us since you landed here. Thought you might care whether or not we win.
Unless someone takes out this enemy, we'll lose Clabburn Sector--and then Hoth. Everything we've sacrificed will be for nothing.
People are waiting on me, General. I hope this mission won't take long.
I won't refuse a call for aid.
The sooner you get rid of our problem, the sooner we take this planet.
I promised my allies I would drive Imperial forces from this sector. I'll honor that commitment.
The Empire must not win.
What's good for them is even better for the Republic.
I didn't slog through all that snow so we could lose. Give me coordinates. I'll handle the rest.
Leave it to me, sir.
All I ask is that you come back alive, Captain. We've lost enough good soldiers here.
Start polishing my medals, General. And don't forget my credits.
Relax, I'm on the job.
You handle this, and I'll pay you out of my own pocket.
Fine--you win. I'll do it.
Our best recon team is scouring the sector to pick up the enemy's trail. Their leader is a Talz commando.
Coordinate with Captain Armaruk. Find whatever is slaughtering our people, and stop it. Good luck.
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
I'll keep looking for some real heroes. Dismissed.
Excuse me. I'm reviewing battle reports.
